docs.snippet: Tuesday evening, Dr. HAYES received a cordial welcome at the Kane Lodge of Masons, corner of Thirteenth-street and Broadway. Besides the members of the Lodge, many visitors were present. THOMAS S. SOMMERS, W.M., made a very neat and appropriate...

headline.main: MASONIC RECEPTION OF DR. HAYES.; PROCEEDINGS AT KANE LODGE. He Describes his Travels in the Arctic Regions.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tuesday evening, Dr. HAYES received a cordial welcome at the Kane Lodge of Masons, corner of Thirteenth-street and Broadway. Besides the members of the Lodge, many visitors were present. THOMAS S. SOMMERS, W.M., made a very neat and appropriate welcoming address, to which Dr. HAYES replied by saying that it gave him great satisfaction to be welcomed back to civilization.

docs.snippet: Private letters from Fort Craig, New-Mexico, under date of Oct. 16, state that there were one thousand soldiers, regulars and volunteers, intrenched there, and that they expected to more into Texas.
docs.lead_paragraph: Private letters from Fort Craig, New-Mexico, under date of Oct. 16, state that there were one thousand soldiers, regulars and volunteers, intrenched there, and that they expected to more into Texas.

docs.snippet: The Twentieth Indiana Regiment arrived at Fortress Monroe in the steamer S.R. Spaulding, this morning, from Hatteras Inlet.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Twentieth Indiana Regiment arrived at Fortress Monroe in the steamer S.R. Spaulding, this morning, from Hatteras Inlet.

docs.snippet: Commodore DUPONT, having sent this vessel home with dispatches, I was fortunate enough to obtain passage by her, and in this letter shall bring my budget of news with reference to affairs at Port Royal to a close.

headline.main: A Visit to Beaufort--The Town in the Hands of the Negroes--The Whites Stampeded in a Panic-- Slaves Pouring into the Union Camps--The Return Home of the Bienville.

headline.main: FIVE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; The Nova Scotian at Father Point. POLITICAL NEWS UNIMPORTANT. Cotton Dull at a Decline Breadstuffs Firm Provisions Dull. GREAT BRITAIN. FRANCE. ITALY. AUSTRIA. PRUSSIA. POLAND. TURKEY. SOUTH AMERICA. CAPE OF GOOD HOPE. LATEST VIA LONDONDERRY.

docs.snippet: The steamer Nova Scotian, from Liverpool, Thursday, the 31st. and Londondery the 1st, arrived here at 8 P.M. She brings five days later intelligence than that of the Persia.

docs.snippet: Capt. DOWELL, of the Twentieth Indiana Regiment, which returned to Fortress Monroe from Hatteras, says that he found it almost impossible to remain longer on that narrow neck of land on account of the loss of camp equipage and stores. Although the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Capt. DOWELL, of the Twentieth Indiana Regiment, which returned to Fortress Monroe from Hatteras, says that he found it almost impossible to remain longer on that narrow neck of land on account of the loss of camp equipage and stores. Although the men have suffered severe privations, the number on the sick-list is very small. All are now comfortably quartered near Fortress Monroe.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: CIVIL WAR (THE WAR BETWEEN THE STATES)

headline.main: THE REBELLION.; Preference of Men for the Volunteer Service A Plan for Filling up the Regular Regiments, & c.

docs.snippet: Since I last wrote to you, everything has passed off quietly here until yesterday, although the secess  have been in sight of us for the last four or five days, on the opposite side of the river.

headline.main: FROM ROSECRANS' ARMY.; The Late Fighting at Gauley A Graphic Sketch of the Skirmishing.

docs.lead_paragraph: Since I last wrote to you, everything has passed off quietly here until yesterday, although the secess have been in sight of us for the last four or five days, on the opposite side of the river.
